trans-unit.source: Example: Importing all data from a file

seg-source.mrk: Example: Importing all data from a file

target.mrk: Example: Importing all data from a file

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to import data into the STAFF table in a sample database from the <codeph>myfile.del</codeph> file. The data will be appended to the existing data in the table.

seg-source.mrk: The following example shows how to import data into the STAFF table in a sample database from the <codeph>myfile.del</codeph> file.
The data will be appended to the existing data in the table.

target.mrk: The following example shows how to import data into the STAFF table in a sample database from the <codeph>myfile.del</codeph> file.
The data will be appended to the existing data in the table.

trans-unit.source: CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_IMPORT_TABLE( null,'STAFF','myfile.del',null,null,null,0);

seg-source.mrk: CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_IMPORT_TABLE( null,'STAFF','myfile.del',null,null,null,0);

target.mrk: CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_IMPORT_TABLE( null,'STAFF','myfile.del',null,null,null,0);

trans-unit.source: Example: Importing all data from a delimited file

seg-source.mrk: Example: Importing all data from a delimited file

target.mrk: Example: Importing all data from a delimited file

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to import data into the STAFF table in a sample database from a delimited data file, <codeph>myfile.del</codeph>. This example defines the percentage character (<codeph>%</codeph>) as the string delimiter, and a semicolon as the column delimiter. The data will be appended to the existing data in the table.

seg-source.mrk: The following example shows how to import data into the STAFF table in a sample database from a delimited data file, <codeph>myfile.del</codeph>.
This example defines the percentage character (<codeph>%</codeph>) as the string delimiter, and a semicolon as the column delimiter.
The data will be appended to the existing data in the table.

target.mrk: The following example shows how to import data into the STAFF table in a sample database from a delimited data file, <codeph>myfile.del</codeph>.
This example defines the percentage character (<codeph>%</codeph>) as the string delimiter, and a semicolon as the column delimiter.
The data will be appended to the existing data in the table.

trans-unit.source: CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_IMPORT_TABLE( null,'STAFF','c:\output\myfile.del',';','%',null,0);

seg-source.mrk: CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_IMPORT_TABLE( null,'STAFF','c:\output\myfile.del',';','%',null,0);

target.mrk: CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_IMPORT_TABLE( null,'STAFF','c:\output\myfile.del',';','%',null,0);

trans-unit.source: Example: Importing all data from a table, using a separate import file for the LOB data

seg-source.mrk: Example: Importing all data from a table, using a separate import file for the LOB data

target.mrk: Example: Importing all data from a table, using a separate import file for the LOB data

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to import data into the STAFF table in a sample database from a delimited data file, <codeph>staff.del</codeph>. The import file <codeph>staff.del</codeph> is the main import file and contains references that point to a separate file which contains the LOB data. This example specifies a comma as the column delimiter. The data will be appended to the existing data in the table.

seg-source.mrk: The following example shows how to import data into the STAFF table in a sample database from a delimited data file, <codeph>staff.del</codeph>.
The import file <codeph>staff.del</codeph> is the main import file and contains references that point to a separate file which contains the LOB data.
This example specifies a comma as the column delimiter.
The data will be appended to the existing data in the table.

target.mrk: The following example shows how to import data into the STAFF table in a sample database from a delimited data file, <codeph>staff.del</codeph>.
The import file <codeph>staff.del</codeph> is the main import file and contains references that point to a separate file which contains the LOB data.
This example specifies a comma as the column delimiter.
The data will be appended to the existing data in the table.

trans-unit.source: CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_IMPORT_TABLE_LOBS_FROM_EXTFILE( null,'STAFF','c:\data\staff.del',',','"','UTF-8',0);

seg-source.mrk: CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_IMPORT_TABLE_LOBS_FROM_EXTFILE( null,'STAFF','c:\data\staff.del',',','"','UTF-8',0);

target.mrk: CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_IMPORT_TABLE_LOBS_FROM_EXTFILE( null,'STAFF','c:\data\staff.del',',','"','UTF-8',0);

trans-unit.source: Example: Importing data into specific columns, using a separate import file for the LOB data

seg-source.mrk: Example: Importing data into specific columns, using a separate import file for the LOB data

target.mrk: Example: Importing data into specific columns, using a separate import file for the LOB data

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to import data into several columns of the STAFF table. The STAFF table includes a LOB column in a sample database. The import file, <codeph>staff.del</codeph>, is a delimited data file. The <codeph>staff.del</codeph> file contains references that point to a separate file which contains the LOB data. The data in the import file is formatted using double quotation marks (<codeph>"</codeph>) as the string delimiter and a comma (<codeph>,</codeph>) as the column delimiter. The data will be appended to the existing data in the STAFF table.

seg-source.mrk: The following example shows how to import data into several columns of the STAFF table.
The STAFF table includes a LOB column in a sample database.
The import file, <codeph>staff.del</codeph>, is a delimited data file.
The <codeph>staff.del</codeph> file contains references that point to a separate file which contains the LOB data.
The data in the import file is formatted using double quotation marks (<codeph>"</codeph>) as the string delimiter and a comma (<codeph>,</codeph>) as the column delimiter.
The data will be appended to the existing data in the STAFF table.

target.mrk: The following example shows how to import data into several columns of the STAFF table.
The STAFF table includes a LOB column in a sample database.
The import file, <codeph>staff.del</codeph>, is a delimited data file.
The <codeph>staff.del</codeph> file contains references that point to a separate file which contains the LOB data.
The data in the import file is formatted using double quotation marks (<codeph>"</codeph>) as the string delimiter and a comma (<codeph>,</codeph>) as the column delimiter.
The data will be appended to the existing data in the STAFF table.

trans-unit.source: CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_IMPORT_DATA_LOBS_FROM_EXTFILE( null, 'STAFF', 'NAME,DEPT,SALARY,PICTURE', '2,3,4,6', 'c:\data\staff.del', ',','"','UTF-8', 0);

seg-source.mrk: CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_IMPORT_DATA_LOBS_FROM_EXTFILE( null, 'STAFF', 'NAME,DEPT,SALARY,PICTURE', '2,3,4,6', 'c:\data\staff.del', ',','"','UTF-8', 0);

target.mrk: CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_IMPORT_DATA_LOBS_FROM_EXTFILE( null, 'STAFF', 'NAME,DEPT,SALARY,PICTURE', '2,3,4,6', 'c:\data\staff.del', ',','"','UTF-8', 0);

trans-unit.source: Example: Exporting all data from a table to a single export file

seg-source.mrk: Example: Exporting all data from a table to a single export file

target.mrk: Example: Exporting all data from a table to a single export file

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to export data from the STAFF table in a sample database to the file <codeph>myfile.del</codeph>.

seg-source.mrk: The following example shows how to export data from the STAFF table in a sample database to the file <codeph>myfile.del</codeph>.

target.mrk: The following example shows how to export data from the STAFF table in a sample database to the file <codeph>myfile.del</codeph>.

trans-unit.source: CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_EXPORT_TABLE( null,'STAFF','myfile.del',null,null,null);

seg-source.mrk: CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_EXPORT_TABLE( null,'STAFF','myfile.del',null,null,null);

target.mrk: CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_EXPORT_TABLE( null,'STAFF','myfile.del',null,null,null);

trans-unit.source: Example: Exporting data from a table to a single delimited export file

seg-source.mrk: Example: Exporting data from a table to a single delimited export file

target.mrk: Example: Exporting data from a table to a single delimited export file

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to export data from the STAFF table to a delimited data file, <codeph>myfile.del</codeph>, with the percentage character (<codeph>%</codeph>) as the character delimiter, and a semicolon as the column delimiter from the STAFF table.

seg-source.mrk: The following example shows how to export data from the STAFF table to a delimited data file, <codeph>myfile.del</codeph>, with the percentage character (<codeph>%</codeph>) as the character delimiter, and a semicolon as the column delimiter from the STAFF table.

target.mrk: The following example shows how to export data from the STAFF table to a delimited data file, <codeph>myfile.del</codeph>, with the percentage character (<codeph>%</codeph>) as the character delimiter, and a semicolon as the column delimiter from the STAFF table.

trans-unit.source: CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_EXPORT_TABLE( null,'STAFF','c:\output\myfile.del',';','%',null);

seg-source.mrk: CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_EXPORT_TABLE( null,'STAFF','c:\output\myfile.del',';','%',null);

target.mrk: CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_EXPORT_TABLE( null,'STAFF','c:\output\myfile.del',';','%',null);

trans-unit.source: Example: Exporting all data from a table, using a separate export file for the LOB data

seg-source.mrk: Example: Exporting all data from a table, using a separate export file for the LOB data

target.mrk: Example: Exporting all data from a table, using a separate export file for the LOB data

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to export data from the STAFF table in a sample database to the main file, <codeph>staff.del</codeph>, and the LOB export file, <codeph>pictures.dat</codeph>.

seg-source.mrk: The following example shows how to export data from the STAFF table in a sample database to the main file, <codeph>staff.del</codeph>, and the LOB export file, <codeph>pictures.dat</codeph>.

target.mrk: The following example shows how to export data from the STAFF table in a sample database to the main file, <codeph>staff.del</codeph>, and the LOB export file, <codeph>pictures.dat</codeph>.

trans-unit.source: CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_EXPORT_TABLE_LOBS_TO_EXTFILE(null,'STAFF', 'c:\data\staff.del',',','"','UTF-8', 'c:\data\pictures.dat');

seg-source.mrk: CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_EXPORT_TABLE_LOBS_TO_EXTFILE(null,'STAFF', 'c:\data\staff.del',',','"','UTF-8', 'c:\data\pictures.dat');

target.mrk: CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_EXPORT_TABLE_LOBS_TO_EXTFILE(null,'STAFF', 'c:\data\staff.del',',','"','UTF-8', 'c:\data\pictures.dat');

trans-unit.source: Example: Exporting data from a query to a single export file

seg-source.mrk: Example: Exporting data from a query to a single export file

target.mrk: Example: Exporting data from a query to a single export file

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to export employee data in department 20 from the STAFF table in a sample database to the file <codeph>awards.del</codeph>.

seg-source.mrk: The following example shows how to export employee data in department 20 from the STAFF table in a sample database to the file <codeph>awards.del</codeph>.

target.mrk: The following example shows how to export employee data in department 20 from the STAFF table in a sample database to the file <codeph>awards.del</codeph>.

trans-unit.source: CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_EXPORT_QUERY( 'SELECT * FROM STAFF WHERE dept=20', 'c:\output\awards.del',null,null,null);

seg-source.mrk: CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_EXPORT_QUERY( 'SELECT * FROM STAFF WHERE dept=20', 'c:\output\awards.del',null,null,null);

target.mrk: CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_EXPORT_QUERY( 'SELECT * FROM STAFF WHERE dept=20', 'c:\output\awards.del',null,null,null);

trans-unit.source: Example: Exporting data from a query, using a separate export file for the LOB data

seg-source.mrk: Example: Exporting data from a query, using a separate export file for the LOB data

target.mrk: Example: Exporting data from a query, using a separate export file for the LOB data

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to export employee data in department 20 from the STAFF table in a sample database to the main file, <codeph>staff.del</codeph>, and the LOB data to the file <codeph>pictures.dat</codeph>.

seg-source.mrk: The following example shows how to export employee data in department 20 from the STAFF table in a sample database to the main file, <codeph>staff.del</codeph>, and the LOB data to the file <codeph>pictures.dat</codeph>.

target.mrk: The following example shows how to export employee data in department 20 from the STAFF table in a sample database to the main file, <codeph>staff.del</codeph>, and the LOB data to the file <codeph>pictures.dat</codeph>.

trans-unit.source: CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_EXPORT_QUERY_LOBS_TO_EXTFILE( 'SELECT * FROM STAFF WHERE dept=20', 'c:\data\staff.del', ',' ,'"', 'UTF-8','c:\data\pictures.dat');

seg-source.mrk: CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_EXPORT_QUERY_LOBS_TO_EXTFILE( 'SELECT * FROM STAFF WHERE dept=20', 'c:\data\staff.del', ',' ,'"', 'UTF-8','c:\data\pictures.dat');

target.mrk: CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_EXPORT_QUERY_LOBS_TO_EXTFILE( 'SELECT * FROM STAFF WHERE dept=20', 'c:\data\staff.del', ',' ,'"', 'UTF-8','c:\data\pictures.dat');
